result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy C Waubanascum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Defendant is legally obligated to file taxes and provide a copy to DOC.

miscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to participate in any AODA Program that may be available to him while in custody.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as stated in Count 1.
Consecutive to: Count 1
Consecutive to: Extended supervision in counts 1 & 2.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Defendant is legally obligated to file federal/state taxes and provide copy to DOC.
The defendant is ordered to participate in any AODA Program that may be available to him while in custody.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as in count 3.
Concurrent with: To Count #3 but consecutive to ES on counts #1 and #2.

Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Randy C Waubanascum in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Randy C Waubanascum in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:40 PM. Erickson has PSI - does not see an errors. State has PSI - makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 3.5 years in WI State Prison System with 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, on all counts but run two counts concurrent to each other and two counts consecutive to each other and consecutive to any sentence that he may be serving now - makes final argument for his recommendation. Erickson makes final argument prior to her recommendation - recommends that any time ordered be concurrent. Waubanascum makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES; #2 - 3.5 with 1.5 years in and 2 years out - consecutive to count #1 - starts today, #3 and #4 - impose 3.5 years in WI State Prison consisting of 1.5 years in and 2 years out - stayed, place on probation for 3 years on each count, concurrent to each other but consecutive ES, credit for 8 days (stipulated), conditions: obtain employment, apply any bond posted to Child Support, waives costs, if the defendant is legally obligated to file taxes, a copy is to be provided to P&P, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on February 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Randy C Waubanascum in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Randy C Waubanascum in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:35 AM. Erickson states that she just received a copy of the PSI today from the Clerk and states that the defendant did not receive a copy either. Everyone has a copy of the PSI now. Court will continue bond, sets for another sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing at 08-25-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Randy C Waubanascum in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:43 AM. State - resolved - defendant will be pleading G to countts #1 thru #4 as alleged, State moves to dismiss and read in c ounts #5 and #6, sentencing is free to argue on both parties, no PSI discussed. Burns agrees and provides court with plea questionnaire and notice for post conviction relief. Court dismisses and reads in counts #5 and #6. Waubenascum pleads G to counts #1, #2, #3 and #4 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering is plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State will be requesting prison, looks to Ms. Burns as if she will be requesting a PSI. Burns - not requesting a PSI for stated reasons. Court will order a PSI for stated reasons, continues bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
